explanation:
Human resource planning identifies human resources requirements of an organization and supply of human resources. The following describes what is identified by this process:
 Replacement of Persons: there are some reasons as to why large number of human resource is recruited in an organization. These reasons are retirement, old age, death, etc. Recruitment could be from internal resources or from external resources. Although for this two case, human resources should get prepared for the vacancy position.
 Labor Turnover: There is always labor turnover in every organization. The degree of labor turnover may vary from concern to concern but it cannot be eliminated altogether. There will be a need to recruit new persons to take up the positions of those who have left the organization. If the concern is able to forecast the turnover rate precisely, then advance efforts are made to recruit and train persons so that work does not suffer for want of workers.
 Expansion Plans: Businesses always want to expand their activities either national or international. Therefore, they expand their activities, employees, facilities, or earnings. Whenever they decide to expand, they should prepare their employees for this change. Employees need to know that there could be new positions.
 Technological Changes: Rapid developments and advances in technology affect the structural and functional qualities of the organizations and create diversity in the production of goods and services. Due to these developments and advances, several jobs disappear, and several new jobs and occupations emerge. New jobs and tasks that arise due to the rapid technological changes require different types of workforce in the organization.
 Assessing Needs: Human resource planning is not only about finding the right person for the right job, it is also about shortage or excess of employees. If there are less persons than needed, it will affect the work negatively. Human resource planning provides the employment of suitable workforce.

options.D: Daily working time → 7,5 hours → minimum 20 minutes
options.E: Daily working time → 7,5 hours → minimum 30 minutes

explanation:
The duration of the daily rest has been determined in consideration to the length of daily working hours as follows:
  • Daily working time ≤ 4 hours → Minimum 15 minutes
  • 4 hours →Daily working time≤ 7,5 hours → 30 minutes
  • Daily working time → 7,5 hours → minimum 60 minutes
The correct answer is C.

text: Which of the following is accurate information about annual paid leave?

options.A: 1 year ≤ length of service ≤ 5 years → minimum 7 days
options.B: 1 year ≤ length of service ≤ 5 years → minimum 10 days
options.C: 5 years → length of service → 15 years → minimum 20 days
options.D: 5 years → length of service → 15 years → minimum 15 days
options.E: Length of service ≥ 15 years → minimum 20 days

explanation:
The duration of the paid annual leave has been determined in consideration to the worker’s length of service as follows:
  • 1 year ≤ length of service ≤ 5 years → minimum 14 days
  • 5 years → length of service → 15 years → minimum 20 days
  • length of service ≥ 15 years → minimum 26 days
The correct answer is C.

text: Who gives the employment certificate to the employee?
explanation: An employment certificate is a letter given by the employer to the worker at the time of the termination of the employment contract. It states the nature and duration of the employment. The correct answer is E.

text: Which of the following sentences explains the severance pay?

options.B: Work which exceeds the maximum weekly working hours (45 hours)
options.C: The lowest level of remuneration determined by the Minimum Wage Fixing Board.
options.D: Sum of money paid at the time when the employment contract is terminated under certain circumstances.
options.E: The highest level of remuneration determined by the Minimum Wage Fixing Board.

explanation: Severance pay is a sum of money paid at the time when the employment contract is terminated under certain circumstances. The correct answer is D.

text: Any person who completes ______ years of age and who is considered as a worker may join a trade union
explanation: According to the TUCLA, any person who completes 15 years of age and who is considered as a worker may join a trade union. The correct answer is B.

text: Which type of contract requires the employer to inform the worker at least four days in advance when he/she requests the worker to work?

options.D: Employment contract for a fixed term

explanation: The call work or work on call means “the performance of work by the worker upon the emergence of the need for his/her services”. In this type of work, the employer must call the worker at least four days in advance when she/he requests the worker to work and must engage the worker in work for a minimum of four consecutive hours at each call unless otherwise is agreed. A is the correct answer.

text: Which of the following is the confederation of employers’ organizations in Turkey?
explanation: There are more than 100 trade unions, most of which are affiliated with five divergent and rival labor confederations (Türk-İş, DİSK, Hakİş, Tüm-İş, and Birlik-İş). There is only one confederation of employers’ organizations, Turkish Confederation of Employers’ Unions (TİSK).

text: Which of the following shows the maximum daily working hours?
explanation:
According to the LA, the working time is maximum 45 hours weekly and 11 hours daily. It shall be divided equally, unless agreed otherwise (art. 63/1, 2). For example, in a company where there are 5 work days, the daily working time will be 9 hours, whereas in a company where the work is performed in 6 working days, the daily working time will be 7,5 hours (Table 1). However, the parties may agree on a
different length of work time on each work day that shall not exceed 11 hours.

 II. The worker is not entitled to severance pay when she/he gives a notice of termination to the employer according to the art. 17, namely if the worker resigns. 
 III. If the worker resigns due to regular military service or retirement, she/he receives the severance pay.

explanation: The female worker who resigns within one year of her marriage is also entitled to have severance pay. text: Which of the following is a mutual rule-making process regulating the terms and conditions of employment?
explanation: Collective bargaining is a mutual rule-making process regulating the terms and conditions of employment. The output of this process, involving negotiations and discussions, is the collective labor agreement. A is the correct answer.

text: Which type of employment contracts means a contract which is deemed to have been made for an indefinite period where the employment relationship is not based on a fixed term?

options.B: Employment contract for a definite (fixed) term
options.E: Employment contract for an indefinite term

explanation: Employment contract for an indefinite term: “An employment contract is deemed to have been made for an indefinite period where the employment relationship is not based on a fixed term” (art. 11/1). In other words, the employment contract which is not for a definite period is called a contract for an indefinite term. All provisions of the LA are applied to the employment contract for an indefinite term.

text: "Public servants are also dependant employees, but they are not workers." According to which of the following laws is a public servant is appointed?

options.C: Occupational Health and Safety Act No: 6331.
options.D: Trade Unions and the Collective Labor Agreement Act No: 6356.

text: Which of the followings refers to a unit where in the workers and material and immaterial elements are organized with a view to ensure the production of goods and services by the employer?
explanation:
Page 211.
Establishment (Workplace): According to the LA, the establishment is a unit wherein the workers and material (building, machinery, equipment, etc.) and immaterial elements (patents, experience, inventions, relations with the customers, etc.) are organized with a view to ensure the production of goods and services by the employer. Therefore, the correct option is E.

text: Which of the followings is correct concerning the trial period?

options.A: The duration of a trial period is maximum 6 months.
options.B: The employer is not obligated to pay any wages or give the rights for the days worked during the probation period.
options.C: During probtion period, either party is free to terminate the contract without paying compensation.
options.D: The duration of a trial period could be extended up to 2 years by collective agreement.
options.E: The trial (probation) period gives a chance to the employer to benefit from low-cost labor.

explanation:
Page 213.
The parties of an employment contract may determine a trial (probation) period that gives a chance to the employer to observe the worker’s suitably to the job and to the worker to experience the workplace and working conditions. During this initial part of an employment contract, either party is free to terminate the contract without paying compensation. However, the employer should pay the wages and give the rights for the days worked (art. 15/2). “If the parties have agreed to include a trial clause in the employment contract, the duration of the trial term shall not exceed 2 months. However, the trial period may be extended up to 4 months by collective agreement” (art. 15/1).

text: Which of the followings is incorrect concerning overtime work?

options.A: In the case of a declaration of mobilization, the worker’s approval for overtime work is not required.
options.B: Overtime work may be required in the case of apotential malfunction.
options.C: Overtime period shall not be more than 270 hours a year for each worker.
options.D: Overtime work is work which exceeds 60 hours a week.
options.E: For normal overtime work, the worker’s written approval is required.

explanation:
Page 218.
Overtime work is work which exceeds 45 hours a week. As mentioned above, the work which exceeds the maximum weekly working hours in the balancing period or compensatory work is not considered as overtime work. There are three types of overtime work:
(i). Normal overtime work: “Overtime work may be performed for purposes such as the country’s interest, the nature of the operation or the need to increase output.” This is defined as normal overtime work (art. 41/1). For normal overtime work, the worker’s written approval is required. Overtime period shall not be more than 270 hours a year for each worker (art. 41/7, 8).
(ii). Compulsory overtime work: Compulsory overtime work may be required in the case of an actual or potential malfunction, or in the case of urgent work to be performed on machinery, tools or equipment, or in the case of force majeure. The workers do overtime work until the establishment operates regularly (art. 42). For example, if the establishment was destroyed by force majeure reasons such as earthquake, fire or flood, the employer may require overtime work until the establishment is ready for its normal operation and production. The worker’s approval for overtime work is not required. The duration of overtime work is limited. The overtime work is finalized when the establishment begins to function regularly.
(iii). Overtime work in emergency (force majeure) situations: In the case of a declaration of mobilization by the President, overtime work in emergency is required at establishments serving the needs of national defense (art. 43). The worker’s approval for overtime work is not required. During the overtime period, the workers work in their maximum capacities. Therefore, the correct option is D.

text: Which of the followings refers to declaration by either party of a contract, in advance, stating the employment contract will be ended?
explanation:
Page 223.
According to the LA, either party may terminate the employment contract for an indefinite term unilaterally by respecting the notice of termination (art. 17). By the notice of termination, either party gives a notice to the other party in advance, declaring that the employment contract will be terminated. Therefore, the correct option is B.

text: Which of the followings refers to a sum of money paid at the time when the employment contract is terminated under certain circumstances?
explanation:
Page 226.
Severance pay is a sum of money paid at the time when the employment contract is terminated under certain circumstances. The LA envisages to establish a severance pay fund. However, the provisions of severance pay in the previous LA, No: 1475, shall be protected until the enactment of the severance pay fund (transitional art. 6). Due to the lack of regulations on the severance pay fund, article 14 of the LA No: 1475, related to severance pay, is still in force. To be entitled to severance pay, the worker under the protection of the LA must have at least one year service at the same establishment or in other units of the same employer, and the employment contract must have terminated under certain circumstances. Therefore, the correct option is C.

text: Which of the followings refers to any concerted cessation by workers of their work with the object of halting the activities of a given establishment or of paralyzing such activities to a considerable extent, or any abandonment by workers of their work in accordance with a decision taken to that effect by an organization?
explanation:
Page 229
Strike: Industrial action is one of the fundamental means of workers and trade unions to solve labor disputes and promote their economic and social interests. Strike is one of the forms of industrial action that is explicitly recognized in most of the countries. According to the TUCLA, strike “means any concerted cessation by workers of their work with the object of halting the activities of a given establishment or of paralyzing such activities to a considerable extent, or any abandonment by workers of their work in accordance with a decision taken to that effect by an organization” (art. 58/1). Strike is a mechanism to settle the collective labor disputes, not an objective of a trade union. During a strike or a lock-out, employment contracts have been suspended, not terminated.
